content: दशा {@--1@} The threads at the end of a piece of woven cloth, the fringe of a garment, the skirt, edge or hem of a garment; रक्तांशुकं पवनलोलदशं वहंती <ls>Mk. 1. 20</ls>; छिन्ना इवांबरपटस्य दशाः पतंति <ls n="Mk.">5. 4.</ls> {@--2@} The wick of a lamp; <ls>Bh. 3. 129</ls>; <ls>Ku. 4. 30</ls>. {@--3@} Age or time of life; see दशांत below. {@--4@} A period or stage of life; as बाल्य, यौवन, &c.; <ls>R. 5. 40.</ls> {@--5@} A period in general. {@--6@} State, condition, circumstances; नीचैर्गच्छत्युपरि च दशा चक्रनामंक्रंमंण <ls>Me. 109</ls>; विषमां हि दशां प्राप्य दैवं गर्हयते नरः <ls>H. 4. 3.</ls> {@--7@} State or condition of mind. {@--8@} The result of actions, fate. {@--9@} The aspect or position of planets (at birth). {@--10@} The mind, understanding.
